category: General Assembly of Delegates and Board of Directors Regulations/Article 20 (Non-face-to-face meetings)
contents: Article 20 (Non-face-to-face meetings) ① Pursuant to Article 17, Paragraph 7 of the Articles of Incorporation, meetings may be held in a non-face-to-face manner, such as through remote communication or submission of written resolutions. However, in this case, agenda items requiring closed or anonymous voting cannot be voted on. ② Meetings conducted by remote communication means (hereinafter referred to as ‘remote video conferences’) conducted by attendance at a location equipped with a device that transmits and receives video and audio simultaneously shall be subject to the following provisions. 1. Delegates individually access the remote video conference system and attend the general meeting. In this case, the delegates are deemed to be present at the same meeting hall. 2. General meetings held through remote video conferencing must retain audio and video of the meeting, and minutes must be prepared in accordance with Article 18 of these regulations. 3. A proxy pursuant to Article 14, Paragraph 3 of the Articles of Incorporation cannot be appointed and allowed to attend the general meeting held through remote video conferencing. ③ The general meeting based on the submission of written resolutions shall be held in accordance with the following provisions. 1. A general meeting based on the submission of written resolutions is held in such a way that all delegates submit written resolutions (including electronic written resolutions) without attending the same location. 2. Delegates who submit a written resolution with their signature and seal are considered to have attended the general meeting. 3. The chairman must notify the delegates in writing (including electronic documents) of the meeting date and agenda, written resolution format, etc., at least 7 days prior to the end of the written resolution period. However, if there are urgent reasons, the period may be shortened. 4. The written resolution is valid from the start date (notification date) of the written resolution pursuant to subparagraph 3 until the end date and time specified in the written resolution until it reaches the chairman by e-mail, etc. 5. The deliberation and resolution date based on the written resolution shall be the end date specified in the written resolution pursuant to subparagraph 3, and the general meeting shall be deemed to have been held on this day. 6. A general meeting based on the submission of a written resolution cannot revise and decide on the agenda. [This article was newly established on October 6, 2021]
